actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications and the Internet.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Telecommunications and the Internet

official_title: To reinstate the authority of the Federal Communications Commission and local franchising authorities to regulate the rates for cable television service.

summary.text: Cable Consumer Rights Act of 2005 - Repeals provisions of the Telecommunications Act of 1996 which prohibit the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) and local cable franchising authorities from regulating the rates for cable television service. Reinstates cable rate regulatory provisions of the Communications Act of 1934 in effect before the enactment of such provisions.

titles.title: To reinstate the authority of the Federal Communications Commission and local franchising authorities to regulate the rates for cable television service.
